title: Angels Notes: Andrew Heaney could get call on short rest for tiebreaker
text:
ARLINGTON, Texas – With their backs to the wall, the Angels are open to going against the book in order to keep their season alive.
Manager Mike Scioscia, who earlier in the week said he would be willing to use Garrett Richards on three days rest Sunday, said Friday he’s also willing to bring Andrew Heaney back on short rest if the Angels have a game Monday.
If the Angels are in a two-way tie with the Houston Astros or Minnesota Twins after Sunday’s regular season finale, they would play a one-game tie-breaker Monday. If they finish in a three-way tie, they would play either Minnesota or Houston or Tuesday.
Monday would be Richards’ turn, but they may need to use him Sunday to get there, which would leave Heaney as the best option.
Heaney threw 84 pitches Thursday night, allowing four runs and taking the loss.
Although neither Richards nor Heaney has ever started on three days rest, Scioscia said it’s a possibility.
“When you are talking about bringing guys back on three days, if you are going to do it three times around the rotation its more of a physical issue,” Scioscia said. “As far as where we are now, it’s more of a mental issue with your routine.”
If the Angels use Richards on Sunday and Heaney on Monday, that would leave Jered Weaver , also on three days rest, as their most likely starter for the wild-card game on Tuesday at Yankee Stadium.
Scioscia said the Angels have all the contingencies mapped out.
“This can change six different ways before you get to Sunday,” he said. “I don’t think there’s any more that can happen that we haven’t worked through.”
ALSO
Matt Shoemaker played catch for the first time in about a week. He said he’s feeling better, but there is no timetable for when he may be able to pitch again. Shoemaker said he’s still holding out hope that if the Angels make the postseason he could pitch sometime. He missed nearly three weeks with forearm tightness, then came back for one start, which he said was probably too soon. He has not thrown off a mound since that Sept. 20 game in Minnesota. ...
Huston Street , out with a strained groin, is with the team and was expected to do some light throwing this weekend. Scioscia said it's "nothing close" to what he would need to do to pitch, though. ...
Johnny Giavotella has six extra base hits among his first eight hits since coming off the disabled list.
